Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Between Main and Clark Streets and immediately adjacent to the Great Northern Way Campus.
Situated between Main and Clark Streets and immediately adjacent to the Great Northern Way Campus.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Located in the False Creek Flats, and on the Central Valley Greenway, 887 Great Northern Way boasts high quality office space in an office and lab building facing China Creek Park, a 3.16 hectare park with running track and playing fields. The building is a 2 minute walk from VCC Clark SkyTrain Station, the current terminus on the Millennium SkyTrain Line. The #84 bus departs from VCC Clark Station, connecting commuters to UBC with a stop at the Olympic Village Canada Line Station. Main Street is 6 blocks away with bus routes giving access to Main Street SkyTrain Station and the rest of the Lower Mainland. To the West of the Building is Emily Carr University, and the newly completed 565 Great Northern Way office building which will increase the vibrancy of this highly sought after neighbourhood.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Ready for it’s next exciting office or retail concept, 191 Alexander Street is well located at the junction of Gastown, Crosstown, andChinatown, and steps to Downtown. Built in 1910, this masterpiece was designed by prominent architectural firm Maclure & Fox and pays homage to Edwardian Free Rationalism style. As a ground level suite, the space boasts a private entrance directly into the space, signage opportunity, rare 16 ft ceilings and a loft feature. The space is surrounded by several prominent office and retail locations including Appnovation, Aritzia HQ, Monstercat, Herschel HQ, Alibi Room, The Birds and the Beets, Ask for Luigi, and more!

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The Landing was originally built in 1907 as one of Vancouver’s first “skyscrapers” and served as one of the largest warehouses in Vancouver devoted to produce serving gold rush miners. In 1988,The Landing was meticulously retrofit to include office, retail and restaurant. The Landing stands as one of the cities most revered heritage buildings, an iconic Vancouver landmark. The Landing is conveniently located only steps away from Waterfront Station - the major transit hub of the City, providing access to all nodes of Metro Vancouver, whether that be by SeaBus, SkyTrain, Canada Line or Westcoast Express. The first building located on the west side of Water Street, The Landing is perfectly situated as the entryway for Gastown on the edge of Downtown.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: THE LANDING | 375 WATER STREET

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: In the heart of Crosstown, and amidst Vancouver’s tech hub, Roberts Block is a 3-storey character heritage office building, extensively renovated in 2012 and benefits from local hands-on ownership and management. With unique floor plan concepts, the building offers portions of exposed brick, and has North Shore views. It also features a modern ductless split air-conditioning system throughout the building and fibre internet. Crosstown is bounded by Gastown, Vancouver’s Central Business District and Yaletown and the emerging neighbourhood has recently seen the addition of new businesses including the new Fendi Casa, Avenue Road furniture and design house, the notable Autostrada Restaurant and the iconic event venue The Permanent, among others.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: NE corner of W Broadway and Granville Street

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: 1477 West Broadway is situated on one of Vancouver’s most prestigious corners, the intersection of West Broadway and Granville. Desirably located along the Broadway Corridor, the building allows for easy connection to downtown and the west side of Vancouver including the University of British Columbia and Vancouver General Hospital. Directly above the future South Granville SkyTrain Station, the site is ingrained with the game changing Broadway Line Extension providing seamless connection to the Canada Line, Expo Line, Millennium Line, West Coast Express, and SeaBus. The location offers additional connectivity by foot and bike with Vancouver’s famous seawall and the Arbutus Greenway a few blocks away. Nestled in the  picturesque Fairview neighborhood, 1477 Broadway is steps away from numerous boutique cafes, restaurants, and amenities in the popular South Granville shopping district.
